item.title: Back to Basics: Recognizing Digits with a Neural Network
item.description:
This will be my first installment in a short series that I’m calling Back to Basics, where I will revisit fundamental topics or problems in machine learning and share what I learned along the way. Typically I will include code samples or links to a repository for those interested in playing around with their own implementations. The purpose of this series is

This is an inline equation: $E = mc^2$.

item.title: About
item.description: Hey there ðŸ‘‹ Welcome to my experimental blog! My name is Jordan and I am a machine learning engineer with an M.Sc. from the RLAI Lab at the University of Alberta. Previously, I’ve worked on computer vision for agricultural robots at Upside Robotics, blockchain collectibles at Dapper Labs, and conversational analytics at Tableau. In my spare time, I enjoy training the art of folding clothes with humans in them, also referred to colloquially as Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.
